 134	class AdvancedCTCHead(nn.Module):
 135	 """Improved CTC head with better initialization and regularization"""
 136	 
 137	 def __init__(self, input_dim: int, vocab_size: int, dropout: float = 0.1):
 138	 super().__init__()
 139	 self.dropout = nn.Dropout(dropout)
 140	 self.layer_norm = nn.LayerNorm(input_dim)
 141	 self.projection = nn.Linear(input_dim, vocab_size + 1) # +1 for blank
 142	 
 143	 # Better initialization
 144	 nn.init.xavier_uniform_(self.projection.weight)
 145	 nn.init.zeros_(self.projection.bias)

 148	 """
 149	 Args:
 150	 x: (B, T, D) encoder outputs
 151	 Returns:
 152	 logits: (B, T, V+1) CTC logits
 153	 """
 154	 x = self.layer_norm(x)
 155	 x = self.dropout(x)
 156	 logits = self.projection(x)
 157	 return logits

 10	class RNNTDecoder(nn.Module):
 11	 """Minimal RNN-T decoder (prediction + joint) for hybrid loss.
 12	
 13	 • Prediction network: 1-layer LSTM with embedding.
 14	 • Joint network: linear(enc_dim) + linear(pred_dim) -> Tanh -> linear(vocab).
 15	 This is NOT an efficient production decoder – it is sufficient for
 16	 computing RNNT loss during training.
 17	 """
 18	
 19	 def __init__(self, vocab_size: int, enc_dim: int, pred_dim: int = 512, embed_dim: int = 128):
 20	 super().__init__()
 21	 self.vocab_size = vocab_size
 22	 self.blank_id = vocab_size # assume blank = vocab_size (same as CTC blank)
 23	
 24	 self.embedding = nn.Embedding(vocab_size + 1, embed_dim) # +blank
 25	 self.pred_rnn = nn.LSTM(embed_dim, pred_dim, num_layers=1, batch_first=True)
 26	
 27	 self.lin_enc = nn.Linear(enc_dim, pred_dim)
 28	 self.lin_pred = nn.Linear(pred_dim, pred_dim)
 29	 self.joint = nn.Linear(pred_dim, vocab_size + 1) # +blank
 30	
 31	 def forward(self, enc_out: Tensor, targets: Tensor, target_len: Tensor) -> Tensor:
 32	 """Compute logits for RNNT loss.
 33	
 34	 enc_out: (B, T_enc, D)
 35	 targets: (B, U) – int64 without blank
 36	 Return: logits (B, T_enc, U+1, vocab+1)
 37	 """
 38	 B, T_enc, D = enc_out.shape
 39	 U = targets.size(1)
 40	
 41	 # prediction network
 42	 emb = self.embedding(targets) # (B,U,E)
 43	 pred, _ = self.pred_rnn(emb) # (B,U,P)
 44	
 45	 f_enc = self.lin_enc(enc_out) # (B,T_enc,P)
 46	 f_pred = self.lin_pred(pred) # (B,U,P)
 47	
 48	 # expand and add
 49	 f_enc = f_enc.unsqueeze(2) # (B,T,1,P)
 50	 f_pred = f_pred.unsqueeze(1) # (B,1,U,P)
 51	 joint = torch.tanh(f_enc + f_pred) # (B,T,U,P)
 52	 logits = self.joint(joint) # (B,T,U,vocab+1)
 53	 return logits ...

 5	from torch import nn, Tensor

 9	
 10	class RNNTDecoder(nn.Module):
 11	 """Minimal RNN-T decoder (prediction + joint) for hybrid loss.
 12	
 13	 • Prediction network: 1-layer LSTM with embedding.
 14	 • Joint network: linear(enc_dim) + linear(pred_dim) -> Tanh -> linear(vocab).
 15	 This is NOT an efficient production decoder – it is sufficient for
 16	 computing RNNT loss during training.
 17	 """
 18	
 19	 def __init__(self, vocab_size: int, enc_dim: int, pred_dim: int = 512, embed_dim: int = 128):
 20	 super().__init__()
 21	 self.vocab_size = vocab_size
 22	 self.blank_id = vocab_size # assume blank = vocab_size (same as CTC blank)
 23	
 24	 self.embedding = nn.Embedding(vocab_size + 1, embed_dim) # +blank
 25	 self.pred_rnn = nn.LSTM(embed_dim, pred_dim, num_layers=1, batch_first=True)
 26	
 27	 self.lin_enc = nn.Linear(enc_dim, pred_dim)
 28	 self.lin_pred = nn.Linear(pred_dim, pred_dim)
 29	 self.joint = nn.Linear(pred_dim, vocab_size + 1) # +blank
 30	
 31	 def forward(self, enc_out: Tensor, targets: Tensor, target_len: Tensor) -> Tensor:
 32	 """Compute logits for RNNT loss.
 33	
 34	 enc_out: (B, T_enc, D)
 35	 targets: (B, U) – int64 without blank
 36	 Return: logits (B, T_enc, U+1, vocab+1)
 37	 """
 38	 B, T_enc, D = enc_out.shape
 39	 U = targets.size(1)
 40	
 41	 # prediction network
 42	 emb = self.embedding(targets) # (B,U,E)
 43	 pred, _ = self.pred_rnn(emb) # (B,U,P)
 44	
 45	 f_enc = self.lin_enc(enc_out) # (B,T_enc,P)
 46	 f_pred = self.lin_pred(pred) # (B,U,P)
 47	
 48	 # expand and add
 49	 f_enc = f_enc.unsqueeze(2) # (B,T,1,P)
 50	 f_pred = f_pred.unsqueeze(1) # (B,1,U,P)
 51	 joint = torch.tanh(f_enc + f_pred) # (B,T,U,P)
 52	 logits = self.joint(joint) # (B,T,U,vocab+1)
 53	 return logits ...

 12	class StreamingGreedyRNNT:
 13	 """Stateful greedy streaming decoder for an *already-trained* :class:`RNNTDecoder`.
 14	
 15	 The implementation follows the standard TIMIT greedy algorithm used in RNNT: for each
 16	 encoder time-step we repeatedly invoke the prediction network until a blank token isg
 17	 emitted, then advance to the next encoder frame.
 18	
 19	 Notes
 20	 -----
 21	 • Supports *only* greedy decoding but is fully streaming: internal predictor state is
 22	 preserved between successive audio chunks.
 23	 • Designed for small to medium vocabularies (≤4k). For larger vocabularies consider
 24	 beam-search with pruning.
 25	 • This helper does **not** own the parameters – it simply holds a reference to a
 26	 frozen :class:`RNNTDecoder` instance.
 27	 """
 28	
 29	 def __init__(self, rnnt: RNNTDecoder, device: torch.device | str = "cpu") -> None:
 30	 self.rnnt = rnnt.eval() # prediction & joint network
 31	 self.device = torch.device(device)
 32	 self.blank_id = rnnt.blank_id
 33	
 34	 # predictor recurrent state (h, c) – initialised lazily
 35	 self._hidden: Optional[Tuple[Tensor, Tensor]] = None
 36	 # last emitted non-blank token (starts with blank)
 37	 self._prev_token: Tensor = torch.tensor([self.blank_id], dtype=torch.long)
 38	
 39	 # ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 40	 # Public helpers
 41	 # ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 42	 def reset(self):
 43	 """Clear internal predictor state – call between utterances."""
 44	 self._hidden = None
 45	 self._prev_token = torch.tensor([self.blank_id], dtype=torch.long)
 46	
 47	 @torch.no_grad()
 48	 def infer(self, enc_out: Tensor) -> List[int]:
 49	 """Greedy-decode *one* encoder chunk.
 50	
 51	 Parameters
 52	 ----------
 53	 enc_out : Tensor
 54	 Encoder outputs of shape ``(B, T, D)`` where ``B == 1``.
 55	
 56	 Returns
 57	 -------
 58	 List[int]
 59	 Sequence of emitted token IDs for this chunk.
 60	 """
 61	 assert enc_out.dim() == 3 and enc_out.size(0) == 1, "enc_out must be (1, T, D)"
 62	 emitted: List[int] = []
 63	
 64	 # Remove batch dimension for convenience → (T, D)
 65	 for enc_t in enc_out.squeeze(0):
 66	 finished = False
 67	 while not finished:
 68	 # Ensure token on same device as model
 69	 if self._prev_token.device != self.rnnt.embedding.weight.device:
 70	 self._prev_token = self._prev_token.to(self.rnnt.embedding.weight.device)
 71	 pred_embed = self.rnnt.embedding(self._prev_token).unsqueeze(0) # (1,1,E)
 72	 pred_out, self._hidden = (
 73	 self.rnnt.pred_rnn(pred_embed, self._hidden)
 74	 if self._hidden is not None else self.rnnt.pred_rnn(pred_embed)
 75	 ) # (1,1,P)
 76	
 77	 f_enc = self.rnnt.lin_enc(enc_t.unsqueeze(0).unsqueeze(0)) # (1,1,P)
 78	 f_pred = self.rnnt.lin_pred(pred_out) # (1,1,P)
 79	 joint = torch.tanh(f_enc + f_pred) # (1,1,P)
 80	 logits = self.rnnt.joint(joint) # (1,1,V+1)
 81	
 82	 next_token = int(logits.argmax(dim=-1))
 83	
 84	 if next_token == self.blank_id:
 85	 # Emit blank → move to next encoder frame
 86	 finished = True
 87	 # Important: predictor *state* is carried forward but previous token
 88	 # resets to blank so that the next prediction starts with blank.
 89	 self._prev_token = torch.tensor([self.blank_id], device=self.rnnt.embedding.weight.device)
 90	 else:
 91	 emitted.append(next_token)
 92	 self._prev_token = torch.tensor([next_token], device=self.rnnt.embedding.weight.device)
 93	 # stay on same encoder frame (finished remains False)
 94	
 95	 return emitted ...

 54	def stream_transcribe(wav_path: str, cfg: ExperimentConfig, encoder, head, decoder, tokenizer, device):
 55	 wav, sr = torchaudio.load(wav_path)

 58	
 59	 chunk_len = int(cfg.audio.sample_rate * 0.64) # 640 ms
 60	 stride = int(cfg.audio.sample_rate * 0.48) # 160 ms overlap
 61	
 62	 offset = 0
 63	 cache = encoder.init_cache(batch_size=1, device=device)
 64	 collected = []
 65	
 66	 while offset < wav.numel():
 67	 end = min(offset + chunk_len, wav.numel())
 68	 chunk = wav[offset:end]
 69	 mel = log_mel(chunk, cfg).unsqueeze(0) # (1,n_mels,T)
 70	 with torch.no_grad():
 71	 enc, cache = encoder.stream_step(mel, cache)
 72	 logits = head(enc)
 73	 log_probs = torch.log_softmax(logits, dim=-1)
 74	 pred_ids = decoder.greedy_decode(log_probs, torch.tensor([enc.size(1)], device=device))[0]
 75	 collected.extend(pred_ids)
 76	 offset += stride
 77	
 78	 return tokenizer.decode(collected)

 131	 def log_mel_spectrogram(self, audio: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:

 140

## Hoàn thành việc loại bỏ CTC và chuyển sang RNN-T only!

### ✅ Những thay đổi đã thực hiện:

#### 1. **Tạo module RNN-T training mới**
- **`rnnt_lightning.py`**: Module training chỉ sử dụng RNN-T, thay thế cho hybrid CTC+RNN-T
- **`models/rnnt_streaming.py`**: Streaming decoder cho RNN-T inference

#### 2. **Cập nhật các file chính**
- **`run.py`**: Thay đổi import từ `StreamingCTC` sang `StreamingRNNT`
- **`streaming_inference.py`**: Thay CTC decoder bằng RNN-T streaming decoder
- **`inference.py`**: Chuyển từ `CTCInference` sang `RNNTInference`

#### 3. **Cập nhật cấu hình**
- **`config.py`**: 
 - Loại bỏ các tham số CTC không cần thiết (`ctc_blank`, `label_smoothing`)
 - Cập nhật tên project từ "improved_ctc_whisper" thành "rnnt_fastconformer"
 - Thêm cấu hình streaming cho RNN-T
 - Loại bỏ các tham số hybrid training

#### 4. **Cập nhật documentation**
- **`README.md`**: Cập nhật cấu trúc file để phản ánh việc sử dụng RNN-T
- **`train.py`**: Thêm comment deprecated để thông báo file đã được thay thế

### Lợi ích của việc chuyển sang RNN-T only:

1. **Streaming inference tốt hơn**: RNN-T được thiết kế đặc biệt cho streaming, không cần buffering như CTC
2. **Latency thấp hơn**: Có thể emit tokens ngay khi có đủ thông tin, không cần đợi toàn bộ sequence
3. **Đơn giản hóa architecture**: Loại bỏ complexity của hybrid training
4. **Memory efficiency**: Không cần lưu trữ CTC head và decoder

### Cách sử dụng:

#### Training:
```bash
python run.py --config config.json
```

#### Streaming Inference:
```bash
python streaming_inference.py --audio audio.wav --checkpoint model.ckpt --config config.json
```

#### Offline Inference:
```bash
python inference.py --audio audio.wav --checkpoint model.ckpt --config config.json --streaming
```

### ⚠️ Lưu ý quan trọng:

1. **Checkpoint compatibility**: Các checkpoint được train với hybrid CTC+RNN-T sẽ cần được retrain với RNN-T only
2. **Performance**: RNN-T có thể cần nhiều epochs hơn để converge so với CTC, nhưng sẽ cho kết quả streaming tốt hơn
3. **Memory usage**: RNN-T decoder có thể sử dụng nhiều memory hơn trong quá trình training do cần tính toán alignment matrix

2. **Latency thấp hơn**: Có thể emit tokens ngay khi có đủ thông tin, không cần đợi toàn bộ sequence
3. **Đơn giản hóa architecture**: Loại bỏ complexity của hybrid training
4. **Memory efficiency**: Không cần lưu trữ CTC head và decoder

### Cách sử dụng:

#### Training:
```bash
python run.py --config config.json
```

#### Streaming Inference:
```bash
python streaming_inference.py --audio audio.wav --checkpoint model.ckpt --config config.json
```

#### Offline Inference:
```bash
python inference.py --audio audio.wav --checkpoint model.ckpt --config config.json --streaming
```

### ⚠️ Lưu ý quan trọng:

1. **Checkpoint compatibility**: Các checkpoint được train với hybrid CTC+RNN-T sẽ cần được retrain với RNN-T only
2. **Performance**: RNN-T có thể cần nhiều epochs hơn để converge so với CTC, nhưng sẽ cho kết quả streaming tốt hơn
3. **Memory usage**: RNN-T decoder có thể sử dụng nhiều memory hơn trong quá trình training do cần tính toán alignment matrix

 137	 def __init__(self, input_dim: int, vocab_size: int, dropout: float = 0.1):
 138	 super().__init__()
 139	 self.dropout = nn.Dropout(dropout)
 140	 self.layer_norm = nn.LayerNorm(input_dim)
 141	 self.projection = nn.Linear(input_dim, vocab_size + 1) # +1 for blank
 142	 
 143	 # Better initialization
 144	 nn.init.xavier_uniform_(self.projection.weight)
 145	 nn.init.zeros_(self.projection.bias)

 149	 Args:
 150	 x: (B, T, D) encoder outputs
 151	 Returns:
 152	 logits: (B, T, V+1) CTC logits
 153	 """
 154	 x = self.layer_norm(x)
 155	 x = self.dropout(x)
 156	 logits = self.projection(x)
 157	 return logits

 10	class RNNTDecoder(nn.Module):
 11	 """Minimal RNN-T decoder (prediction + joint) for hybrid loss.
 12	
 13	 • Prediction network: 1-layer LSTM with embedding.
 14	 • Joint network: linear(enc_dim) + linear(pred_dim) -> Tanh -> linear(vocab).
 15	 This is NOT an efficient production decoder – it is sufficient for
 16	 computing RNNT loss during training.
 17	 """
 18	
 19	 def __init__(self, vocab_size: int, enc_dim: int, pred_dim: int = 512, embed_dim: int = 128):
 20	 super().__init__()
 21	 self.vocab_size = vocab_size
 22	 self.blank_id = vocab_size # assume blank = vocab_size (same as CTC blank)
 23	
 24	 self.embedding = nn.Embedding(vocab_size + 1, embed_dim) # +blank
 25	 self.pred_rnn = nn.LSTM(embed_dim, pred_dim, num_layers=1, batch_first=True)
 26	
 27	 self.lin_enc = nn.Linear(enc_dim, pred_dim)
 28	 self.lin_pred = nn.Linear(pred_dim, pred_dim)
 29	 self.joint = nn.Linear(pred_dim, vocab_size + 1) # +blank
 30	
 31	 def forward(self, enc_out: Tensor, targets: Tensor, target_len: Tensor) -> Tensor:
 32	 """Compute logits for RNNT loss.
 33	
 34	 enc_out: (B, T_enc, D)
 35	 targets: (B, U) – int64 without blank
 36	 Return: logits (B, T_enc, U+1, vocab+1)
 37	 """
 38	 B, T_enc, D = enc_out.shape
 39	 U = targets.size(1)
 40	
 41	 # prediction network
 42	 emb = self.embedding(targets) # (B,U,E)
 43	 pred, _ = self.pred_rnn(emb) # (B,U,P)
 44	
 45	 f_enc = self.lin_enc(enc_out) # (B,T_enc,P)
 46	 f_pred = self.lin_pred(pred) # (B,U,P)
 47	
 48	 # expand and add
 49	 f_enc = f_enc.unsqueeze(2) # (B,T,1,P)
 50	 f_pred = f_pred.unsqueeze(1) # (B,1,U,P)
 51	 joint = torch.tanh(f_enc + f_pred) # (B,T,U,P)
 52	 logits = self.joint(joint) # (B,T,U,vocab+1)
 53	 return logits ...

 10	class RNNTDecoder(nn.Module):
 11	 """Minimal RNN-T decoder (prediction + joint) for hybrid loss.
 12	
 13	 • Prediction network: 1-layer LSTM with embedding.
 14	 • Joint network: linear(enc_dim) + linear(pred_dim) -> Tanh -> linear(vocab).
 15	 This is NOT an efficient production decoder – it is sufficient for
 16	 computing RNNT loss during training.
 17	 """
 18	
 19	 def __init__(self, vocab_size: int, enc_dim: int, pred_dim: int = 512, embed_dim: int = 128):
 20	 super().__init__()
 21	 self.vocab_size = vocab_size
 22	 self.blank_id = vocab_size # assume blank = vocab_size (same as CTC blank)
 23	
 24	 self.embedding = nn.Embedding(vocab_size + 1, embed_dim) # +blank
 25	 self.pred_rnn = nn.LSTM(embed_dim, pred_dim, num_layers=1, batch_first=True)
 26	
 27	 self.lin_enc = nn.Linear(enc_dim, pred_dim)
 28	 self.lin_pred = nn.Linear(pred_dim, pred_dim)
 29	 self.joint = nn.Linear(pred_dim, vocab_size + 1) # +blank
 30	
 31	 def forward(self, enc_out: Tensor, targets: Tensor, target_len: Tensor) -> Tensor:
 32	 """Compute logits for RNNT loss.
 33	
 34	 enc_out: (B, T_enc, D)
 35	 targets: (B, U) – int64 without blank
 36	 Return: logits (B, T_enc, U+1, vocab+1)
 37	 """
 38	 B, T_enc, D = enc_out.shape
 39	 U = targets.size(1)
 40	
 41	 # prediction network
 42	 emb = self.embedding(targets) # (B,U,E)
 43	 pred, _ = self.pred_rnn(emb) # (B,U,P)
 44	
 45	 f_enc = self.lin_enc(enc_out) # (B,T_enc,P)
 46	 f_pred = self.lin_pred(pred) # (B,U,P)
 47	
 48	 # expand and add
 49	 f_enc = f_enc.unsqueeze(2) # (B,T,1,P)
 50	 f_pred = f_pred.unsqueeze(1) # (B,1,U,P)
 51	 joint = torch.tanh(f_enc + f_pred) # (B,T,U,P)
 52	 logits = self.joint(joint) # (B,T,U,vocab+1)
 53	 return logits ...

 12	class StreamingGreedyRNNT:
 13	 """Stateful greedy streaming decoder for an *already-trained* :class:`RNNTDecoder`.
 14	
 15	 The implementation follows the standard TIMIT greedy algorithm used in RNNT: for each
 16	 encoder time-step we repeatedly invoke the prediction network until a blank token isg
 17	 emitted, then advance to the next encoder frame.
 18	
 19	 Notes
 20	 -----
 21	 • Supports *only* greedy decoding but is fully streaming: internal predictor state is
 22	 preserved between successive audio chunks.
 23	 • Designed for small to medium vocabularies (≤4k). For larger vocabularies consider
 24	 beam-search with pruning.
 25	 • This helper does **not** own the parameters – it simply holds a reference to a
 26	 frozen :class:`RNNTDecoder` instance.
 27	 """
 28	
 29	 def __init__(self, rnnt: RNNTDecoder, device: torch.device | str = "cpu") -> None:
 30	 self.rnnt = rnnt.eval() # prediction & joint network
 31	 self.device = torch.device(device)
 32	 self.blank_id = rnnt.blank_id
 33	
 34	 # predictor recurrent state (h, c) – initialised lazily
 35	 self._hidden: Optional[Tuple[Tensor, Tensor]] = None
 36	 # last emitted non-blank token (starts with blank)

 42	 def reset(self):
 43	 """Clear internal predictor state – call between utterances."""
 44	 self._hidden = None
 45	 self._prev_token = torch.tensor([self.blank_id], dtype=torch.long)
 46	
 47	 @torch.no_grad()
 48	 def infer(self, enc_out: Tensor) -> List[int]:
 49	 """Greedy-decode *one* encoder chunk.
 50	
 51	 Parameters
 52	 ----------
 53	 enc_out : Tensor
 54	 Encoder outputs of shape ``(B, T, D)`` where ``B == 1``.
 55	
 56	 Returns
 57	 -------
 58	 List[int]
 59	 Sequence of emitted token IDs for this chunk.
 60	 """
 61	 assert enc_out.dim() == 3 and enc_out.size(0) == 1, "enc_out must be (1, T, D)"

 63	
 64	 # Remove batch dimension for convenience → (T, D)
 65	 for enc_t in enc_out.squeeze(0):
 66	 finished = False
 67	 while not finished:
 68	 # Ensure token on same device as model
 69	 if self._prev_token.device != self.rnnt.embedding.weight.device:
 70	 self._prev_token = self._prev_token.to(self.rnnt.embedding.weight.device)

 72	 pred_out, self._hidden = (
 73	 self.rnnt.pred_rnn(pred_embed, self._hidden)
 74	 if self._hidden is not None else self.rnnt.pred_rnn(pred_embed)
 75	 ) # (1,1,P)
 76	
 77	 f_enc = self.rnnt.lin_enc(enc_t.unsqueeze(0).unsqueeze(0)) # (1,1,P)
 78	 f_pred = self.rnnt.lin_pred(pred_out) # (1,1,P)
 79	 joint = torch.tanh(f_enc + f_pred) # (1,1,P)
 80	 logits = self.rnnt.joint(joint) # (1,1,V+1)
 81	
 82	 next_token = int(logits.argmax(dim=-1))
 83	
 84	 if next_token == self.blank_id:
 85	 # Emit blank → move to next encoder frame
 86	 finished = True
 87	 # Important: predictor *state* is carried forward but previous token
 88	 # resets to blank so that the next prediction starts with blank.
 89	 self._prev_token = torch.tensor([self.blank_id], device=self.rnnt.embedding.weight.device)
 90	 else:
 91	 emitted.append(next_token)
 92	 self._prev_token = torch.tensor([next_token], device=self.rnnt.embedding.weight.device)
 93	 # stay on same encoder frame (finished remains False)
 94	
 95	 return emitted ...

 41	def log_mel(audio, cfg: ExperimentConfig):
 42	 with torch.no_grad():
 43	 mel = torchaudio.transforms.MelSpectrogram(
 44	 sample_rate=cfg.audio.sample_rate,

 54	def stream_transcribe(wav_path: str, cfg: ExperimentConfig, encoder, head, decoder, tokenizer, device):
 55	 wav, sr = torchaudio.load(wav_path)
 56	 wav = torchaudio.functional.resample(wav, sr, cfg.audio.sample_rate)
 57	 wav = wav.squeeze(0).to(device)
 58	
 59	 chunk_len = int(cfg.audio.sample_rate * 0.64) # 640 ms
 60	 stride = int(cfg.audio.sample_rate * 0.48) # 160 ms overlap
 61	
 62	 offset = 0
 63	 cache = encoder.init_cache(batch_size=1, device=device)
 64	 collected = []
 65	
 66	 while offset < wav.numel():
 67	 end = min(offset + chunk_len, wav.numel())
 68	 chunk = wav[offset:end]
 69	 mel = log_mel(chunk, cfg).unsqueeze(0) # (1,n_mels,T)
 70	 with torch.no_grad():
 71	 enc, cache = encoder.stream_step(mel, cache)
 72	 logits = head(enc)
 73	 log_probs = torch.log_softmax(logits, dim=-1)
 74	 pred_ids = decoder.greedy_decode(log_probs, torch.tensor([enc.size(1)], device=device))[0]
 75	 collected.extend(pred_ids)
 76	 offset += stride
 77	
 78	 return tokenizer.decode(collected)
